page.title: 14Norfolk Agricultural Station
page.content: The Norfolk Agricultural Station was set up about 100 years ago and is a private organisation with charitable status. The station moved to Morley from Sprowston Hall about 20 years ago. Currently it uses about 450 acres of land and employs a permanent staff of 17, including the farm staff. Staff from other institutions, such as the Ministry of Agriculture are often seconded to the Station to work on particular projects. Funding is partly from the members of the charity, but largely from sponsorship for research. The Agricultural Station gives much help to the local community by allowing use of their land and helping with labour for village projects. SC21CS
